item.title: GameStop's Biggest Sale Of The Year Includes AAA Games For $15
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gamestops-biggest-sale-of-the-year-includes-aaa-games-for-15/1100-6531678/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

GameStop is offering steep discounts on PS5, Xbox, and Switch games right now, giving you a chance to pick up hit games for $15 or $30. Hundreds of titles are included in the event, and there’s even a nice selection of cheap Amiibo if you’re searching for collectibles. The event seems to be quite popular, however, as inventory for select titles is beginning to run out. We’d recommend checking out the sale soon if you’re looking to snag a few cheap games. The sale ends May 31. If a game you want is out of stock, you'll want to circle back and check again, as GameStop has restocked some of the titles already.

You’ll need to spend $79 to get free shipping from GameStop, so consider bundling multiple games together to get the most out of the sale. If you need help filling up your cart, you’ll find a random selection of Blu-ray films in the $15 catalog. You can avoid the shipping costs by picking up your games at your local GameStop store (if stock is available).

$15 Games

Most of the games in the $15 catalog are a few years old, but this is a great opportunity to pick up something you may have missed at launch. For example, the massive Dead Island 2: Hell-A Edition is now just $15 (was $100). The bloody RPG earned solid reviews at launch, and this version gets you the expansion pass and physical collectibles like a steelbook, tarot cards, pin badges, and a patch. You can also dive into the divisive Dragon Age: The Veilguard for $15, which is an easy recommendation at this new price.

Over on Switch, the popular Persona 5 Tactica is on sale for $15, as is Kingdom Come Deliverance: Royal Edition. The latter includes all released DLC, making it a fantastic way to catch up on the adventure before checking out its sequel.

PS5

  • Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 -- $15 ($70)
  • College Football 25 -- $15 ($30)
  • Dead Island 2: Hell-A Edition -- $15 ($100)
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard -- $15 ($70)
  • Dustborn: Limited Retail Edition -- $15 ($40)
  • FC 25 -- $15 ($50)
  • Forspoken -- $15 ($70)
  • Ghostrunner 2 -- $15 ($30)
  • Madden NFL 25 -- $15 ($50)
  • Neon White -- $15 ($20)
  • Story of Seasons: A Wonderful Life -- $15 ($30)

Switch

  • FC 25 -- $15 ($50)
  • Immortals: Fenyx Rising -- $15 ($30)
  • The Karate Kid: Street Rumble -- $15 ($20)
  • Kingdom Come Deliverance: Royal Edition -- $15 ($30)
  • Persona 5 Tactica -- $15 ($20)
  • Silent Hope: Day 1 Edition -- $15 ($30)
  • Trinity Trigger: Day 1 Edition -- $15 ($30)

Xbox

  • College Football 25 -- $15 ($30)
  • Diablo 4: Cross-Gen Bundle -- $15 ($60)
  • Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed -- $15 ($40)
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard -- $15 ($70)
  • FC 25 -- $15 ($50)
  • Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth -- $15 ($70)
  • Madden NFL 25 -- $15 ($50)
  • Star Wars Jedi: Survivor -- $15 ($50)
  • Story of Seasons: A Wonderful Life -- $15 ($30)
  • Unicorn Overlord -- $15 ($60)
  • Visions of Mana -- $15 ($60)
  • Warhammer 40,000: Darktide -- $15 ($30)

$30 Games

The catalog for $30 games isn’t quite as sprawling, but there are a bunch of great deals to peruse. Marvel’s Avengers didn’t exactly win over critics--but the Earth’s Mightiest Edition is on sale for $30 (was $150). Beyond the game, this comes with a 12-inch Captain America statue, Hulk bobblehead, Mjolnir keychain, and heaps of other goodies. So even if you don’t intend to play the game for long, all the collectibles make this a great deal.

Other impressive options include Assassin’s Creed Valhalla: Ultimate Edition Steelbook (PS4) for $30 (was $110), Bayonetta Origins: Cereza and the Lost Demon for $30 (was $60), and Final Fantasy 16 for $30 (was $40). Super Mario RPG is also discounted to $30 (was $50). Our review gave it an 8/10 and called it “an authentic ode to a classic.”

PS5

  • Assassin’s Creed Valhalla: Ultimate Edition Steelbook (PS4) -- $30 ($110)
  • Diablo 4 -- $30 ($60)
  • Final Fantasy 16 -- $30 ($40)
  • Harvest Moon: The Winds of Anthos -- $30 ($40)
  • Marvel’s Avengers: Earth’s Mightiest Edition (PS4) -- $30 ($150)
  • Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition -- $30 ($110)

Switch

  • Bayonetta Origins: Cereza and the Lost Demon -- $30 ($60)
  • Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 1 -- $30 ($40)
  • Star Wars: Heritage Pack (7 Games) -- $30 ($60)
  • Super Mario RPG -- $30 ($50)
  • WarioWare: Move It -- $30 ($50)

Xbox

  • Disney Dreamlight Valley: Cozy Edition -- $30 ($40)
  • Life is Strange: Double Exposure -- $30 ($50)
  • Mortal Kombat 1: Premium Edition -- $30 ($110)
  • Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown -- $30 ($40)
  • Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition -- $30 ($110)
  • Starfield -- $30 ($70)

Nintendo Amiibo Figures for $10

Looking for a few collectibles? A handful of Amiibo are cheap at GameStop. Remember--you’ll need to hit $79 for free shipping, so consider picking up one or two of these if you need to reach the threshold. From Pikachu and Ness to Charizard and Daisy, a few great models are on sale.

  • Super Smash Bros. Charizard -- $10 ($16)
  • Super Smash Bros. Pikachu -- $10 ($16)
  • Super Smash Bros. Ness -- $10 ($16)
  • Super Smash Bros. Daisy -- $10 ($16)
  • Super Smash Bros. Duck Hunt -- $10 ($16)
  • Highly Limited Super Mario Bros. 30th Anniversary 4K Blu-Ray In Stock At Amazon
  • Lego Monkey Palace Board Game Is Over 50% Off At Amazon Right Now
  • 8BitDo Reveals Leverless Arcade Controllers For PC, Switch, And Xbox
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • Locke & Key Keyhouse Comic Compendium Gets Massive Limited-Time Discount
  • Lego's Awesome New Mario Kart Display Set Is Available Now
  • First Book In Joe Abercrombie's New Fantasy Series Is Finally Here
  • Amazon Restocks Lego Transformers Optimus Prime, Offers Big Discount
  • PSA: Lego Bowser's Muscle Car Is Retiring - Save Big On 3 Mario Sets Before They're Gone
Jon Bitner on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Interactive GTA 6 Map Made By Fans Highlights More Than 100 Points Of Interest
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/interactive-gta-6-map-made-by-fans-highlights-more-than-100-points-of-interest/1100-6531683/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

An interactive fan-made map for Grand Theft Auto 6 just received a major update, and now includes more than 100 point-of-interest locations and landmarks as pieced together from the game's trailers.

The map of the fictional state of Leonida, shared on Reddit by user kalterapfel123, is still a work-in-progress. It currently sports screenshot locations, points of interest, major cities, and more, all compiled by the GTA mapping community based on trailer analysis, community findings, and alleged leaks.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: GTA 6 (Grand Theft Auto VI) - Official Release Date Reveal | Trailer 2

Though the map gives a good general idea of what the actual GTA 6 map might look like, there's still plenty of speculation involved. Clicking on one of the various city icons makes clear when a location's inclusion on the map is based on a leak or on a real-life Florida location that is not yet confirmed to be present in GTA 6. Most of the map locations can be found in Vice City or the Leonida Keys regions, with the central and more northern parts of Leonida relatively empty so far.

It's an ambitious project and one that looks to be gaining some traction in the community. Users on Reddit have volunteered to help translate the map, which is currently available in English and German, into other languages like Spanish and Portuguese. No doubt the map will continue to be fleshed out ahead of the game's official map reveal, but in the meantime, here are all the main GTA 6 locations we know so far.

Rockstar recently revealed a second trailer for GTA 6 and confirmed footage in the trailer was captured on a base PlayStation 5 and included both cutscenes and gameplay. The trailer came shortly after Rockstar announced GTA 6 had been delayed and will release May 26, 2026 instead of in 2025.

While the delay was disappointing for fans, the CEO of Take-Two, Rockstar's parent company, said another GTA 6 delay is unlikely, and that the delay was necessary to support the development team "in their search for perfection."

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Black Ops 6 Season 4 Brings Back Fan-Favorite Villain As New Operator
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/black-ops-6-season-4-brings-back-fan-favorite-villain-as-new-operator/1100-6531682/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is gearing up for its next season, and we now know that a fan-favorite villain is returning as a playable Operator. Activision has announced that Stitch, the one-eyed scarred nemesis of series stalwart Russell Adler, will be headlining the additions coming in Season 4.

As teased in a post on X, Vikhor "Stitch" Kuzmin will be playing a role in Black Ops 6's evolving narrative going forward. Stitch originally showed up in Black Ops Cold War and also appeared in the original Warzone mode; he has extensive lore and has become an iconic character in the franchise due to his savage look and reminiscence to Batman villain Bane. Activision confirmed that Season 4 will be dropping next week, on May 29.

While Activision has yet to fully unveil the new season, eagle-eyed Call of Duty fans have spotted new additions in data files contained within Black Ops 6. As shared by X account DETONATEDcom, Season 4 is expected to add an Olympia shotgun, a new revolver, brass knuckles, and the Grim Reaper scorestreak. We will likely get an official rundown of the upcoming season in the next few days.

In addition to the normal seasonal content, Black Ops 6 also received a DLC pack to mark Military Appreciation Month. The Call of Duty Endowment United Force tracer pack contains new items in addition to Operators based on real soldiers. All proceeds from the DLC, which costs $20, go to the Call of Duty Endowment, a charity that helps veterans transition to civilian careers following their retirement from the military.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: The New MSI Claw A8 Switches From Intel To AMD Hardware
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-new-msi-claw-a8-switches-from-intel-to-amd-hardware/1100-6531679/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

At this year's Computex trade show, MSI officially revealed its updated Claw PC gaming handheld. One of the major changes with this new model is that it sports an AMD Ryzen Z2 Extreme processor under the hood, which should be able to handle several graphically intense games on its eight-inch FHD display.

Other hardware specs for the Claw A8 BZ2EM model include an AMD Radeon 890M GPU, a 120Hz refresh rate for the screen, a 1TB M2 SSD, and it's equipped with "up to 24GB" of LPDDR5-800 memory. This will be available in two different colors--white and lime green--and the company says that it has also aimed to make it ergonomically appealing. These efforts have resulted in contours that are meant to feel more natural in your hand, and the joysticks, bumpers, D-pad, and Hall-Effect triggers have also been redesigned.

Pricing or a release date have yet to be revealed, but for reference, the currently available MSI Claw 8+ with Intel hardware currently costs $1,000.

MSI's first turn at producing a Steam Deck competitor wasn't well-received when it first launched in early 2024. While it was praised for being comfortable to hold and its sound was top-notch in comparison to its competitors, the MSI Claw also had notoriously poor performance and a terrible battery life.

Like the Asus ROG Ally, it also runs on Windows 11, which isn't exactly the best operating system to navigate on a small screen, even if it does allow the user more flexibility when it comes to playing games compared to the Steam Deck, which utilizes SteamOS.

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Returnal Dev Not Looking To Make Live-Service Or Free-To-Play Games
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/returnal-dev-not-looking-to-make-live-service-or-free-to-play-games/1100-6531676/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Returnal developer Housemarque, which is owned by Sony, has said it isn't planning to make live-service or free-to-play games, not so long as people are "buying premium games."

Studio head Ilari Kuittinen told Eurogamer, "Our philosophy is that [our games] are an experience for a certain time of your life, and you experience that within a few days, or weeks, or whatever."

He added: "You don't need to spend the rest of your free time with our games." Creative director Gregory Louden said Housemarque is "fully focused on single-player and premium" games.

Live-service games can be lucrative--if a game can break through popular ongoing games like Fortnite, Minecraft, GTA Online, and Call of Duty--and that's proven to be challenging for some newcomers.

Housemarque's next game is Saros, and it's a spiritual sequel to Returnal. It is set for release in 2026 for PS5, and for lots more, be sure to read GameSpot's coverage of everything we know about Saros.

There was a point in time when Sony was planning to release a dozen live-service titles by 2026, but the company later cut that number in half. One of Sony's high-profile live-service games, Concord, had a disastrous launch in 2024 and was quickly shut down.

Some of Sony's upcoming live-service games include Bungie's Marathon and Fairgame$ from Haven Studios. Both of those projects have encountered issues lately, as Bungie admitted to using unauthorized art in Marathon, while a report said Fairgame$ had a rough external test, with studio boss Jade Raymond departing the company.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
